de.hallenbeck.indiserver.communication_drivers
Class PL2303driver

java.lang.Object
  de.hallenbeck.indiserver.communication_drivers.PL2303driver
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class PL2303driver
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

PL2303 USB Serial Converter Driver for devices with Android usbhost-support (3.2 upwards) Based on pl2303.c from linux sources: http://lxr.free-electrons.com/source/drivers/usb/serial/pl2303.c Supports PL2303 and newer PL2303HX-types (both tested) with ProductID 0x2303 and VendorID 0x067b TODO: support 3rd party USB IDs (see linux driver) Supports basic RTS/CTS FlowControl TODO: add RFR/CTS, DTR/DSR and XON/XOFF FlowControl

Author:
atuschen75 at gmail dot com

getInputStream

public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
Get the InputStream of the connection. Supported functions: read() - blocking read (only one byte) read(byte[], int, int) - non-blocking read (any size)

Returns:
InputStream if connected else null

getOutputStream

public java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
Get the OutputStream of the connection. Supported functions: public void write(int) - blocking write (only one byte) public void write(byte[], int, int) - non-blocking write (any size)

Returns:
OutputStream if connected else null

run

public void run()
Runnable for detection of DSR, CTS , DCD and RI Calls the appropriate Callback-function on status change UsbRequest on Endpoint zero returns 10 bytes. Byte 9 contains the line status.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
